Jack Traven.Action: Immediately exits vehicle and heads straight for the entrance, taking the lead with his partner and team following.
Raises his hand and smiles while volunteering Harry to examine the device, facilitating teamwork and showing friendly confidence.
Leads the SWAT team confidently without apparent arrogance or harshness, indicating trustworthy and cooperative behavior.
Takes the lead naturally as the team assembles and moves with precision.
Identifies that the basement could stop the elevator, showing awareness of building infrastructure relevant to the crisis.
Volunteers Harry to examine the bomb device, demonstrating leadership and confidence in delegating roles suitably.
Smiles and calmly informs passengers to stay relaxed during an elevator malfunction
Addresses passengers with a friendly tone and tries to soothe their confusion and relief
Uses humor ('Am I lying?') to lighten tense moments
Shows trust and deference to Harry's expertise ('You're the expert. I just work here.')
Focuses on operational details and urgent tactical decisions without displaying empathy or emotional connection in this excerpt
Refuses to shoot the hostage despite a tactical suggestion to do so, showing reluctance to harm innocents.
Considers alternatives to keep hostages safe rather than accepting violent solutions.
Displays a blunt, somewhat harsh tone when dismissing Harry's comment ('enough already').
Reassures Harry confidently 'It'll hold' to comfort his partner despite his own uncertainty.
Engages in friendly banter with Harry about why he took the job, showing camaraderie.
Quietly secures the hook next to C4, focused on the task, showing responsibility rather than emotional expression.
Confidently assures Harry the cable will hold despite tension and danger.
Carefully and skillfully descends headfirst into the elevator shaft on a rope to secure the cable hook to the elevator frame.
Quietly secures the hook to part of the elevator frame near explosives, showing caution and awareness.
Takes one final look down the elevator shaft before risking himself to stop the bomb by throwing himself through the access panel.
Without hesitation acts to save passengers in danger, showing concern for their safety.
Communicates clearly and cooperates with Harry to rescue the passengers.
Observes the slack cable and takes one final look down before acting.
Without hesitation, hurls himself through the access panel as the bomb explodes.
Immediately commands to get the passengers off after the elevator stops.
Looks at Harry and bolts as the winch breaks free, showing quick decision making.
Shouts instructions calmly to coordinate rescue efforts.
Helps pull multiple trapped people from a dangerous elevator.
Shows urgency and determination to save strangers in peril.
Quickly assesses the elevator situation and acts decisively by opening the elevator doors and instructing people to get on the floor to increase their safety.
Effortfully pulls people out of the elevator as it is dangerously falling, showing physical capability and calm under pressure.
Recognizes the urgency to rescue the last woman trapped with her legs still inside the falling elevator, continues pulling with all their strength.
Ultimately fails to pull the last woman out before the elevator drops, indicating limitations in his ability to prevent a disaster despite efforts.
Pulls the woman to safety from a falling elevator, sharing a look of relief and concern with Harry.
Engages in light, somewhat teasing conversation with Harry about the bomber's impatience.
Decides to slide down the elevator cable without hesitation despite personal risk.
Leads rescue effort by pulling the woman away from the falling elevator just in time.
Reassesses bomb threat situation logically by deducing bomber’s location and intentions with Harry.
Questions assumptions proactively about freight elevators and checks them out, demonstrating thoroughness.
Slides down elevator cable to investigate freight elevator, taking personal physical risk to gather information.
Does not hesitate when investigating unknown situations, acting decisively despite unknown dangers.
Immediately concerned about Harry after he is shot and falls, shouting his name.
Keeps trying to protect Harry and himself under heavy gunfire, showing loyalty and commitment to his partner.
Focuses on tactical survival and defending against Fisk, prioritizing the mission over personal safety, which may limit outward warmth expressions.
Pulls his 9mm Glock and steps lightly onto the elevator car, showing caution and preparedness.
Attempts to open hatch cover under enemy fire, coordinating with Harry through countdown signals.
Jumps feet first through the pen hatch into the elevator despite danger.
Unable to return fire effectively because he hears Harry yelling and does not know where to shoot.
Quickly brings up his gun when shotgun is empty, commands Fisk to drop the gun confidently.
Fails to protect Harry from being knocked out and falling into the elevator, showing vulnerability or miscalculation.
Keeps steady aim at Fisk to protect hostage Harry, maintains calm under pressure.
Mocks Fisk by saying 'I'm pretty much there already' when Fisk threatens him.
Refuses to shoot the hostage despite direct orders; shoots Harry in the leg to prevent further harm.
Focuses on action and duty with little visible emotional response; no overt friendliness or empathy shown in this excerpt.
Shoots the hostage Harry in the leg to prevent Fisk from escaping, showing decisive and tactical action under pressure.
Continues to shoot Fisk while pursuing him, reloading on the run, demonstrating focus, skill, and persistence.
Is knocked back by a massive explosion and lies still, indicating vulnerability but no failure or poor decision is directly shown here.
Stands in full dress uniform at the medal ceremony alongside Harry with a calm and professional demeanor.
Gives a reluctant, self-deprecating speech at the cops' celebration, making light of the situation and including others humorously.
Initially resists giving a speech, showing some discomfort engaging socially.
Receives a medal in a formal ceremony acknowledging his actions.
Gives a somewhat awkward and humorously self-deprecating speech at the bar despite reluctance, showing social confidence but minor discomfort.
Joins McMahon at the bar and shares a personal anecdote about his father and proving himself.
Jokingly imitates a drunken Harry, showing lightheartedness and camaraderie.
Vaguely paws at Robin as she stands, a female cop, indicating inappropriate, possibly unwelcome physical behavior.
Engages in friendly, casual conversation with McMahon about the nature of police work.
Engages in casual, lighthearted banter with colleagues, demonstrating social ease without losing focus.
Corrects McMahon about a woman’s name after a brief hesitation, showing some minor memory lapse.
Responds to Harry’s drunken behavior with calm humor and control, not escalating the situation.
Helps Harry get up when he is swaying and struggling.
Encourages a friend realistically about his condition but in a caring way.
Reflects on a personal relationship (Katie) with tenderness and vulnerability.
Acknowledges the danger they faced and the need to think beyond guts and luck after capturing the criminal.
Helps Harry up after the confrontation, showing awareness and care.
Wakes up hangovered, bleary-eyed, showing impaired state upon waking.
Despite hangover, perseveres and pushes himself to go for a run, shaking off the bleariness.
Responds politely and lightly to Bob's teasing comments about partying.
Instinctively moves forward to help after bus explosion but is forced back by flames.
Stares in shock after the explosion, taking a moment before responding to the phone.
Answers the threatening phone call calmly, shows focus despite tension.
Half-turns instinctively as the bus explodes and moves forward to help despite the flames forcing him back.
Notices the ringing phone amidst shock and moves to answer it, indicating presence of mind under stress.
Does not appear to panic or flee hastily after the explosion, instead processes situation calmly.
Concerned about the bus driver and the passengers' safety, tries to find the bus and defuse the situation.
Engages calmly with the antagonist and tries to gather information without hostility.
Shows strain and tension when responding to threats but maintains focus on protecting others.
Pauses and accepts the bomb threat challenge, quickly focusing on understanding the problem.
Shows initial hesitation and almost loses it when confronted with the threat.
Demonstrates calmness by checking his watch and assessing the time constraints carefully.
Asks relevant questions that challenge the antagonist and push the investigation forward.
Pulls over and runs alongside the bus to warn and stop it from going into the accident area
Grins reassuringly that the situation is going to be okay despite chaos
Urgently knocks on bus door and commands to stop, showing concern for passengers' safety
Frantically weaves in and out of traffic to reach the bus.
Pulls over onto the right shoulder, quickly gets out, and hurriedly runs to intercept the bus.
Knocks on the bus door and tries to get the driver to stop despite being barely audible inside.
Flashes badge and commands Jaguar owner to get out of his car calmly but firmly to pursue the bus.
Physically chases the bus, running exhausted and putting himself in danger despite obstacles.
Retrieves badge after dropping it, despite being bumped by a car; pursues the bus on foot and attempts to stop it physically even though the doors won't open.
Fails to open bus doors when trying to stop it, is left behind as the bus gets away.
Stops oncoming traffic by standing in front of cars and successfully raises alarm, then decisively confronts Jaguar owner, flashes badge, draws gun, commands compliance confidently.
Hesitates briefly before entering Jaguar; shows measured caution but quickly takes control of vehicle to pursue bus.
Warns the bus passengers about the bomb despite communication difficulties, urgently tries to get their attention in a dangerous situation.
Commands the Jaguar owner to write 'Bomb on bus' on sheet music to communicate the threat, showing resourcefulness and determination.
Chases the bus skillfully, uses flashing lights and honking to get attention.
Quickly tries to communicate the bomb threat by flashing badge and instructing the Jaguar owner to write a clear message.
Takes initiative to find a creative way to warn the bus passengers despite noise and inability to hear.
Accelerates sharply and maneuvers the Jaguar in front of the bus to deliver the warning despite some hesitation from the Jaguar owner.
Urgently instructs Sam to maintain bus speed to prevent bomb detonation, clearly showing concern for passenger safety.
Communicates quickly and effectively with police and other authorities to address the threat on the bus.
Drives aggressively but with clear concern for the bus and its passengers, trying to communicate and coordinate with Sam to keep the bus safe.
Takes physical risk by opening the Jaguar door on the highway and preparing to jump to the bus to help.
Yells instructions to others for their safety and tries to trust the panicked Jaguar owner to take control, showing reliance on others and calm in crisis.
Drives recklessly on the shoulder to keep up with the bus and assess the situation, showing quick decision-making under pressure.
Realizes the Jaguar door will be an obstacle and carefully opens it wide while driving, demonstrating problem-solving and physical skill.
Instructs the Jaguar owner to take control of the steering and prepares to jump, showing planning and leadership.
Has to leap from his moving car and grab the bus handrail, indicating adaptability and physical bravery despite personal risk.
Has his shoulder wrenched and feet dragging on pavement, which might imply a momentary loss of control or underestimating danger.
Drops his badge to show he’s not acting as a cop right now, attempts to defuse tension by presenting himself as 'two cool guys just hanging on the bus.'
Rushes to stop a violent struggle, disarms and subdues the attacker to protect others.
Shows urgency and calm in instructing passengers to keep the bus above 50 mph to prevent bomb detonation, communicating serious danger sincerely and clearly.
Firmly confronts a passenger (Terry) who threatens to cause trouble, using an intense tone that stops the potential disruption.
Disarms and subdues Ray with two quick blows despite chaos and gunfire.
Instructs Annie not to slow the bus to prevent bomb explosion, displaying quick situational assessment and clear communication.
Handcuffs Ray firmly and warns passengers about consequences of trying to escape, maintaining control under pressure.
Momentarily falters in speech and appears fumbling at start of interaction, indicating slight nervousness or lack of polish.
Encourages everyone to stay calm and in control, directly addresses Ortiz to maintain order.
Approaches Annie, noticing her fear and asking if she can handle driving the bus, showing concern and attentiveness.
Allows himself a grin when Annie admits to speeding, showing a moment of lightness and humanity.
Takes control of the situation by instructing Annie on what to do, exhibiting leadership without harshness or impatience.
Stays calm and gives clear instructions in a high-pressure situation, ensuring everyone remains orderly.
Assesses Annie’s ability to drive the bus and presses for confirmation, showing concern for safety and control.
Uses calm, confident communication to help Annie regain composure and focus on the task.
Takes initiative by making a strategic phone call during the crisis, working to coordinate next steps.
Allows himself a small grin after learning Annie’s speeding offense, demonstrating confidence and controlled humor amidst tension.
Carefully inspects the bus for explosives, communicates findings clearly and calmly to colleagues, trying to manage the situation with composure.
Takes responsibility to personally check the dangerous undercarriage despite risk, involving others by handing off the phone appropriately, demonstrating trust and collaboration.
Carefully inspects the bus by opening the access panel and describes the bomb setup accurately to others calmly.
Acknowledges he cannot get under the bus because it is in motion, demonstrating situational awareness.
Does not blindly follow Harry's warning about the decoy, continuing to investigate thoroughly.
Warns passengers to hold on amid chaos and danger on the bus.
Commands Annie firmly yet urgently on how to navigate through traffic to avoid disaster.
Decides to take risky maneuvers to save people despite danger, showing concern and responsibility.
Calls Mac in a calm, friendly manner updating him on their situation, showing cooperative communication and concern.
Shares a look of relief with Annie, indicating nonverbal emotional connection and empathy.
Stomps on the gas decisively instead of hesitating over the brake when facing a dangerous situation.
Maintains communication with McMahon to navigate the city streets, showing situational awareness and reliance on support.
Looks helplessly as the bus hits the baby carriage and the woman jumps clear, showing his horror and concern.
Smiles after the baby carriage knocks over soda and beer cans, trying to lighten the mood.
Gives clear instructions to Annie to keep calm and prepared for the upcoming difficult turn, showing concern and support.
Identifies the construction site turn ahead despite limited visibility and directs Annie to prepare for it.
Remains calm and communicates effectively with Annie and MacMahon under pressure.
Makes a quick judgment call on the turn at the construction site based on the patrol cars' maneuvers.
Expresses frustration or worry ('we're boned!') which shows momentary doubt.
Commands passengers firmly to move to one side of the bus to maintain balance and safety during a dangerous turn.
Assists Annie by grabbing the wheel and holding the bus steady during the turn, sharing responsibility and support.
Smiles at passengers after successfully stabilizing the bus, trying to reassure and calm them.
Compliments Annie saying 'Ma'am, you did very well,' showing encouragement and respect.

Directs passengers to move to one side of the bus to balance it during a difficult turn, communicates calmly and clearly under pressure, and physically helps control the bus steering with Annie to safely navigate the turn.
Calmly coordinates with Mac on the phone to clear the site ahead, demonstrating foresight and strategic thinking.
Smiles reassuringly at the passengers after successfully stabilizing the bus, indicating confidence and ability to maintain morale.
Compliments Annie on her driving, acknowledges her skill and remains calm under pressure.
Provides a clear, concise explanation of the antagonist's motives and the stakes of the situation.
Displays awareness of the ongoing threat and the repeated nature of the antagonistic game, showing experience.
Engages in informal, humanizing conversation rather than staying fully focused on threat, showing balanced social skills but not distraction.
Shows concern for injured passenger Sam, asks about his condition.
Refuses to unload passengers despite pressure, citing orders and practical concerns.
Appeals to Fisk for an act of faith to help the injured man, showing empathy and willingness to bend rules for kindness.
Refuses to unload passengers against orders, insisting on following protocol despite pressure.
Demonstrates situational awareness by informing leadership of the visible news helicopters and the risks of movement.
Asks about the injured passenger's condition and shows concern, indicating attentiveness.
Attempts to negotiate with Fisk by appealing to empathy to help the injured man onboard.
Pushes the boundary of rules by asking permission to try to unload the driver despite Fisk's resistance.
Reassures and coordinates with others during a tense rescue, asks about Sam's condition sincerely.
Focuses on unloading only the driver initially, ignoring the concerns of other passengers.
Coordinates with Ortiz and SWAT to unload the wounded driver carefully while managing the situation under pressure.
Communicates effectively through walkie-talkie to McMahon and gives clear instructions to keep the wounded straight.
Physically supports the injured Sam while ensuring safety during the risky exchange between buses/trucks.
Responds urgently and tries to prevent Helen from jumping into a dangerous situation.
Grabs at Helen to try to save her when the bus swerves and she falls.
Shouts aggressively into the walkie talkie to get choppers off his back.
Commands McMahon to get the helicopters off his back using the walkie-talkie, showing assertiveness and quick thinking under pressure.
After being knocked down and failing to catch Helen as she falls, he sits back stunned momentarily, indicating a slight lapse or moment of being overwhelmed.
Calms down a chaotic situation by demanding order and addressing hostages calmly.
Shows emotional intelligence by comforting Annie, acknowledging her trauma realistically and empathetically.
Keeps focus on the bigger threat (the bomber) rather than getting distracted by hostages' emotions.
Responds calmly to the crisis, acknowledges the danger, tries to find a solution actively.
Does not provide false hope or dismiss fears; he is realistic about the situation.
Does not panic or show frustration; remains focused and collaborative with others.

Upon learning about the missing section of the freeway, he quickly processes the information and agrees on the risky but potentially effective solution to floor the engine and attempt to jump the gap.
Is momentarily at a loss for an immediate answer when questioned about what to do next, indicating initial uncertainty.
Instructs passengers calmly to hold onto seats and protect themselves, showing concern for their safety.
Responds to Ray’s apology with a not unkind acceptance, signaling understanding and forgiveness.
Protects Annie by pushing her down and covering her, showing protective and caring behavior.
Calmly instructs passengers to hold on and secure their belongings, showing control and clear communication under pressure.
Reassures a scared Stephens by confidently saying 'Definitely' when asked if the plan will work.
Unlocks Ray's cuffs and manages to maintain authority with a calm but not unkind tone.
Physically protects Annie by pushing her down and covering her to help hold the bus steady during a dangerous jump.
Checks on Annie immediately after the terrifying bus jump, showing concern.
Addresses all passengers to ensure everyone is okay, showing care and responsibility.
Smiles big and shows honest admiration toward Annie, dabbing her blood with his sleeve, showing tenderness and kindness.
Checks on Annie and passengers' wellbeing promptly after the crash landing of the bus.
Maintains calm and encourages passengers, eliciting positive, reassuring responses.
Kneels by Annie to tend to her injury and offers genuine admiration, showing care and presence of mind.
Commands Annie to get off the bus quickly and takes control of the wheel to act decisively for passengers' safety.
Urgently directs Annie where to drive to avoid danger, showing concern for protecting others.
Grabs the wheel and swerves the bus sharply to avoid delay despite passenger yelling, taking control decisively.
Quickly directs Annie to the airport cargo entrance to evade pursuers and buy time.
Adjusts plan on the fly by instructing Annie to avoid a patrol car and navigate tricky obstacles like tire spikes, showing adaptability under pressure.
Answers the phone calmly and directly without unnecessary pleasantries.
Challenges Fisk to show commitment and insists on clear boundaries (only him on the ground).
Maintains firm and unsentimental tone in negotiation with Fisk.
Answers the phone calmly and directly, engages in negotiation with Fisk.
Challenges Fisk to show commitment by letting Jack get on the ground alone, demonstrating control of the situation.
Keeps his tone professional and assertive during tense conversation.
Responds with a short 'What do you want?' showing confidence but minimal information gathering.
Reassures the passengers and tells them 'Don't worry... I won't go far'
Tenderly brushes Annie's hair from her face, showing sincerity and care
Refuses to dump the passengers despite pressure, demonstrating responsibility and concern for others' safety
Assures the group calmly and confidently before leaving the bus briefly, showing leadership and control over a tense situation.
Explains clearly to McMahon why unloading passengers is not an option due to the bus bomber’s readiness and tendency to be one step ahead, demonstrating situational awareness and strategic thinking.
Shows uncertainty verbally ('I don't know how'), but uses this uncertainty constructively to remain cautious and prepared, indicating measured competence rather than ignorance.
Smiles at Annie and gives her a thumbs up to reassure her.
Calmly communicates and coordinates with team under extreme pressure, focusing on defusing the bomb.
Keeps composed and reassuring to others (e.g., gives thumbs up to Annie), showing support and encouragement.
Calmly lies flat while inching under the bus with a bomb, maintaining composure under extreme pressure.
Carefully inspects the bomb's wiring, correctly identifies the timer setup and communicates technical details clearly.
Follows expert advice from Harry to carefully cut the sheath without damaging critical wiring, works methodically despite limited visibility.
Warns Harry and others to watch their backs, showing concern for their safety.
Asks Mac to pull him out, showing trust and reliance on his teammate.
Carefully handles the bomb components, focusing on the task rather than showing emotional warmth or friendliness.
Feels a cloud crossing his expression upon realizing he can't bypass the wire, indicating internal concern but not necessarily warmth.
Thanks Ortiz after being pulled into the bus, acknowledges concern from Terry.
Focuses on survival and defusing the bomb, minimal verbal interaction beyond necessary communication.
Grabs screwdriver and uses it to get a grip on the undercarriage to avoid falling off the moving bus.
Quickly reacts to hydraulic spray by pulling himself away and searching for safety.
Communicates clearly with Ortiz to coordinate rescue.
Lets go of the screwdriver at the right moment to grab Ortiz’s shoulder and be pulled up safely.
Remains conscious and alert despite pain, answers questions and confirms the bomb has not gone off.
Smiles in a tense situation, interacts gently with Annie, shows concern about leaking gas, and tries to keep calm.
Responds to Ortiz's crude compliment with a mild rebuke, maintaining a friendly tone.
Keeps Annie informed and reassures her despite danger.
Expresses anger and grief clearly after learning Harry did not survive, showing emotional sincerity.
Calls Fisk in anger and threatens him, showing protective and loyal feelings toward Harry.
Demonstrates emotional control and focuses on the situation despite the loss of his friend Harry.
Recognizes immediately that Harry did not survive after a pause on the phone.
Responds with intense anger and threat after learning of Harry's death.
Throws the phone in anger, struggles to respond but endures under pressure.
Smiles winningly at Annie when she encourages him to stay strong and be part of the solution.
Kneels and daubs Annie's brow, speaking softly and engaging in friendly conversation about her shirt and university.
Smashes the phone in frustration but quickly regains composure and smiles winningly at Annie, showing emotional control and leadership under pressure.
Pauses and reflects to engage Annie in calm conversation, using a personal connection to maintain calm and focus among the hostages.
Initially appears unable to respond verbally after smashing the phone, showing momentary lapse in outward leadership.
Shushes Annie to keep her quiet and calm, instructs her to act scared as part of the plan.
Holds up a finger to shush Mrs. Kamino to avoid causing alarm or panic.
Notices the hidden camera on the bus and realizes the antagonist is watching them from the start.
Calmly instructs Annie to do nothing and act scared to avoid escalating the situation.
Communicates efficiently with McMahon, coordinating a strategic plan involving a news van and UHF broadcasting.
Silences Mrs. Kamino gently but firmly to maintain control of the situation.
Quietly instructs everyone to remain calm and appear resigned in a tense situation.
Pays attention to the safety of everyone on the bus and tries to make careful decisions about when to unload due to fuel leak.
Quietly instructs everyone to remain calm and not make big movements, showing awareness and control.
Recognizes the fuel leak and promptly decides to evacuate the bus despite limited time, demonstrating quick, decisive thinking.
Uses the walkie talkie to communicate with McMahon about the fuel situation and coordinates action to run the tape loop, showing effective communication under pressure.
Looks back and forth between his watch and the gas gauge anxiously, which may suggest concern but also attentiveness.
Urges passengers to evacuate calmly and quickly, helps Mrs. Kamino and Terry off the bus, coordinates with Annie and McMahon to rig controls to save the bus.
Shouts a warning to Stephens, tries to catch him when he jumps toward the truck.
Strides confidently to the back doors and directs Annie to open the emergency door.
Takes the initiative to rig the gas pedal and steering wheel by accepting materials and preparing to use them.
Organizes the evacuation of passengers efficiently under severe pressure.
Attempts to grab Stephens as he panics and jumps for the truck, showing quick reflexes though missing the catch.
Helps Annie get down into the hole under the bus, showing care and cooperation.
Focused on managing the crisis with Annie, showing teamwork and concern for others’ safety.
Quickly picks up and uses the 3x5 floor panel with a rope to attempt stabilizing the bus running out of control.
Gives clear, urgent commands (e.g., 'Wedge down the pedal! Hurry!') showing leadership and clear-headedness under pressure.
Helps Annie down safely into the hole, showing presence of mind and care for others amid crisis.
Takes one last look ahead to assess the situation, showing situational awareness and careful planning.
After escaping the explosion, he instinctively covers Annie's head and stays on top of her to protect her from falling debris.
Looks at Annie with concern and asks if she is all right.
Does not say something 'mushy' or overtly sentimental to Annie after the traumatic event.
Jumps down through a hole in the windshield to avoid being nearly decapitated by a plane wing crashing through the bus.
Holds onto Annie securely while they slide to a stop on the sled under the bus.
Stays calm and checks on Annie's well-being immediately after the bus explodes.
Does not rush into a sentimental reaction after the traumatic event, maintaining composure.
Introduces Annie to Captain McMahon in a friendly, respectful manner.
Shares a moment of almost laughter with Annie after a tense event, showing lightness and connection.
Places his hand over McMahon's hand to gently stop impulsive action, demonstrating empathy and consideration.
Insists on keeping Annie out of harm's way by requesting she be moved back from danger despite her desire to stay close.
Appears increasingly agitated and focused on safety, demonstrating concern for others' well-being.
Recognizes that the suspect is not late and trusts his timing instincts.
Becomes increasingly agitated but remains focused on the situation.
Requests to turn on the homing beacon despite Norwood's hesitation.
Commands Norwood to activate the homing device quickly to track the money bags.
Runs quickly to follow the trail and pursues the person carrying the money bags with a gun drawn.
Confronts the person with a threat in a tense situation, showing no hesitation.
Reacts with shock and concern upon discovering Annie strapped with explosives, indicating care and emotional connection.
Insists on letting Annie go despite the threat and Fisk's reluctance, prioritizing her safety over money or tactical advantage.
Immediately commands Norwood to activate the homing device, quickly reacts to new information, and pursues the suspect through the tunnel without hesitation.
Quickly assesses the situation when Annie reveals the bomb, maintains composure under pressure, and refuses to shoot her despite the threat.
Attempts to negotiate by urging Fisk to let Annie go after he has the money, showing strategic thinking and prioritizing human life.
Runs after the captors, blows open locked door to rescue Annie, shows determination to save her.
Yells warnings to people on platform to get off the train.
Surprised and focused on stopping the bomb threat, no evident hostility or aggression beyond necessary violence (shooting door handle).
Blows the door handle to pieces to open a locked door and enters the subway station.
Runs down the stairs and sprints along the platform to catch the moving train, successfully grabbing onto the fourth car.
Crouches carefully, attempts to move stealthily to avoid detection and protect others.
Climbs on top of the train to pursue Fisk despite the danger.
Does not abandon Annie despite Fisk's threats and dangerous situation.
Clutches his wounded arm in agony but continues to try to defend himself against Fisk's brutal attack.
Grabs the deadman's stick from Fisk at the last second to save lives.
Calms Annie by showing the disarmed deadman's stick, offering reassurance.
Attempts to free Annie from handcuffs desperately, pulling until her wrists bleed, showing intense urgency.
Pushes Annie to jump off train despite her resistance, showing conflict between his protective instincts and harsh reality.
Grabs Fisk's hand and takes the deadman's stick at the last second, preventing disaster.
Defuses the C-4 and neutralizes the deadman's stick quickly.
Assesses and tries all available controls on the damaged train equipment, including switching levers and radio, showing adaptability under pressure.
Attempts to free Annie from handcuffs and tries to unscrew the pole, but fails.
Reacting emotionally by kicking the pole and pulling at handcuffs till Annie's wrists bleed.
Listens to Annie’s warning and evaluates the track map to decide to keep the train going faster to safely navigate the curve and avoid the dead end.
Holds onto the pole near Annie, remains silent but physically supportive amid danger.
Pulls Annie's hands free after crash, then shares a desperate kiss and reassures her he didn’t leave her.
Turns the knob hard right to take the curve, bracing himself and Annie for the difficult ride despite the danger ahead.
Holds Annie tight after she drops her cuffs, showing calmness and control in a stressful situation.
Remains silent and focused during the risky jump through the station and curve, demonstrating confidence and steadiness.
Pulls Annie's hands free and ensures they are both safe after the crash, showing quick thinking and care.
Does not abandon Annie when the situation becomes dangerous, indicating emotional as well as practical competence.
Says minimal words, possibly indicating reserved or stoic behavior, but no indication of incompetence or confusion.
Admits that watching bowling on TV excites him and cheers aloud when watching it.
Tells Annie it's over and she can walk away, but does so without harshness.
Responds to Annie's playful cuffing with a lighthearted 'Whatever you say, Ma'am,' and sits with her.
Thinks before answering Annie's question, giving a calm, slightly humorous response about watching bowling on TV.
Directly tells Annie the situation is over and she can walk away, showing clarity and confidence.
Allows Annie to handcuff him despite the earlier stance, showing willingness to trust and adapt; may suggest confidence but also a controlled vulnerability.
